primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God transforms the reality of death, empire, and mourning into a reality of life, praise, and dancing through the victory of the Slain Lamb.

tekstueel_bewijs: the slain lamb... is the ruling lamb
the power of God in the form of vulnerability that can defeat the threat of death
You [God] have turned my mourning into dancing
turning death to life, hatred to love, and despair to hope
restored me to life from among those who go down to the Pit

zender.identificatie: The Easter Event / The Truth of God
tekstueel_bewijs: The news that Christ is risen... is a claim that is too deep for explanation
Easter resurrection is the truth of God’s life in the world

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The World / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: the whole of saved creation gathered around the throne
Singing evokes energy and permits us to engage in playful, imaginative, daring speech
Ananias... sent him to tutor Paul

tegenstander.identificatie: The Empire / Death / The Status Quo / Self-Sufficiency
tekstueel_bewijs: every empire and every controlling regime
the power of greed, the force of fear, and the leverage of violence
our money and our learning have put the lid on our singing
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'the power of death' and 'every empire,' requiring a divine intervention (Easter) to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer responds to God's transformation by singing 'outrageous' songs of defiance and gratitude.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Defiance of the Status Quo / Doxology
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The singing (Secondary) is a participation in and response to the Easter victory (Primary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Singing → The Slain Lamb ← The Empire/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: You have taken off my funeral cloths
Jesus... said to him: 'Go, for he is an instrument whom I have chosen'
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Paul and his friends singing 'Amazing Grace'

voorbeelden: desire to engage in playful speech
What the church knows is that such outrageous, dangerous singing is evocative
power of God surging through our lives
vulnerability that can defeat the threat of death

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) released by the Easter event which enables the 'Performance' of singing and defiance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Lid' of self-sufficiency (~S1) to the reality of Death (S2), then through the Slain Lamb to Easter (S1), resulting in Defiance (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Slain Lamb' who occupies the place of S2 (Death) to open S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and empire are presented as real threats that prose cannot solve.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. God/Christ is the primary actor who transforms the human condition. Singing is a derivative response to an objective divine act.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the more affluent and sophisticated we are, the more feebly we sing

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: You have turned my mourning into dancing
vulnerability embodied by Christ will defeat all savage power

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul and the Psalmist are used not as moral examples to imitate, but as case studies of what God's power does to a person.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: 'Paul’s life was interrupted by the abrupt appearance of Jesus'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment (Pouvoir) rather than burden (Devoir).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic (Revelation) to the historical (Paul) to the personal (Psalm 30) is logically anchored in the same actantial engine.
spanning_punten: The opening sociological critique slightly borders on a 'Devoir' (you should sing better) before shifting to 'Pouvoir' (God enables singing).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the power of God in the form of vulnerability that can defeat the threat of death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'energy' for singing is an endowment from the Easter event.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is linked to 'Empire' and 'The Pit'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strongly grace-oriented structure where God is the Subject of the primary verbs of transformation.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Pouvoir (which is good for grace).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'must' of the conclusion is clearly a 'cannot-help-but' response to the 'can' of the Gospel.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as Empire and Death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative while calling for a vigorous human response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Trump metaphor or the sociology of singing; actantial analysis reveals these are merely 'Helpers' or 'Opponents' to the central work of the Lamb.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the Hebrew of Psalm 30; Greimas shows how the Psalm functions as a 'Performance' following a 'Competence' granted by God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Singing' is not the Object of the sermon, but a 'Helper' that allows the Receiver to participate in the Subject's (God's) victory.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper-God' trap where God merely assists human effort.
